attributes.text:
@dev withdraw provider reward of a given token address
@param _tokenAddress 1. address of the token to withdraw rewards

devdoc.details: SLA is a service level agreement contract used for service downtime compensation

params._periodId: 1. the id of the given period
3. the id of the given period
params._timestamp: 1. the time the SLI has been registered

_claimCompensation(address).details: claim user compensation. Transfers both the compensation and the user remaining stake.

params._tokenAddress: 1. address of the token to claim compensation

addAllowedTokens(address).details: add a token to ve allowed for staking

params._tokenAddress: 1. address of the new allowed token

claimUserCompensation(address).details: withdraw provider reward of a given token address

params._tokenAddress: 1. address of the token to withdraw rewards

params._extraData: 9. array of bytes32 to store extra data on deployment time
params._ipfsHash: 3. string with the ipfs hash that contains SLA information
params._owner: 1. address of the owner of the service level agreement
params._periodIds: 4. id of the allowed canonical periods
params._periodType: 5. period type of the SLA contract
params._slaID: 10. identifies the SLA to uniquely to emit dTokens

getAllowedTokensLength().details: use this function to evaluate the length of the allowed tokens length

isAllowedToken(address).details: checks in the allowedTokens array if there's a token with _tokenAddress value

returns._0: true if _tokenAddress exists in the allowedTokens array

isStaker(address).details: returns true if the _staker address is registered as staker

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

registerSLI(uint256,uint256).details: external function to register SLI's and check them against the SLO's

params._periodId: 2. the id of the given period
params._sli: 1. the value of the SLI to check

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._token: 2. address of the ERC to be staked

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params._tokenAddress: 2. address of the ERC to be staked

_breachedContract.details: states if the contract was breached or not

ipfsHash.details: The ipfs hash that stores extra information about the agreement

periodIds.details: array of he allowed canonical period ids

slaRegistry.details: The address of the slaRegistry contract

devdoc.title: SLA

_claimCompensation(address).notice: it uses the user position and the user total position per token to check the proportion of the compensation pool that corresponds to every user
